checkout.header_text: Submit your visit for Dewabi Org to review.

submission_confirmation.title: Visit Submitted
submission_confirmation.bottom_text: Dewabi Org will review your visit shortly.

transitions.message: We'll start by asking you questions about your symptoms.
Now let's take photos for your doctor to make a diagnosis.
Now we'll ask you some questions about your medical history.
That's all the information your doctor will need!

questions.question_title: Let's make sure Spruce is right for you. Are you experiencing any of the following?

popup.text: This question helps assess whether you're healthy enough to be diagnosed and treated remotely.

body.text: Your symptoms suggest that you may need more immediate medical attention than we can currently provide. A local emergency department is an appropriate option, as is your primary care provider.

screens.content_header_title: We're going to have to end your visit here.

body.text:
If you have health insurance, you should contact your insurance company to find out which providers are covered under your plan. Locate your insurance card and call the listed Member Services number. A representative will help you locate your nearest in-network emergency department. If you are too ill to accomplish this, call 911 and go to the nearest emergency department.

If you do not have health insurance, go to the most convenient emergency department.

screens.content_header_title: You should seek in-person medical evaluation today. A local emergency department is an appropriate option, as is your primary care provider (if you can be seen immediately today).

questions.question_title: Are you still able to complete basic daily activities, such as walking, eating, and caring for yourself?

questions.question_title: Have you had this type of rash before?

body.text: Your answers suggest that your doctor will be in a better position to evaluate your condition if you submit a "Rash" visit instead.

screens.content_header_title: We recommend you start a new "Rash" visit

body.text: This visit will gather all the information your doctor needs to diagnose your rash.

screens.content_header_title: Begin Your Rash Visit

questions.question_title: Have you been diagnosed with eczema by a doctor or other healthcare professional in the past?

body.text: Your answers suggest that your doctor will be in a better position to evaluate your condition if you submit a "Rash" visit instead.

screens.content_header_title: We recommend you start a new "Rash" visit

body.text: This visit will gather all the information your doctor needs to diagnose your rash.

screens.content_header_title: Begin Your Rash Visit

questions.question_title: When did this current rash start?
Eczema rashes often come and go. When did you first have a rash like this current one?
questions.question_summary: First had a rash like this one

potential_answers.potential_answer: When I was a young child
potential_answers.potential_answer_summary: When I was a young child

questions.question_title: Eczema can be frustrating. How has your mood been?

body.text: Feeling depressed can be common with eczema, but it can also be dangerous. For your best care, please be seen urgently today by a medical professional. Please tap 'Next Steps' for how to proceed.

screens.content_header_title: We're going to have to end your visit here.

body.text:
If you have health insurance, you should contact your insurance company to find out which providers are covered under your plan. Locate your insurance card and call the listed Member Services number. A representative will help you locate your nearest in-network urgent care center or other appropriate provider. If you are too ill to accomplish this, call 911 and go to the nearest emergency department.

If you do not have health insurance, go to the most convenient urgent care or emergency department.

screens.content_header_title: You should seek in-person medical evaluation today. A local urgent care is an appropriate option, as is your primary care provider.

questions.question_title: Which areas of your body are currently affected by rash?

body.text: A rash that affects both the mouth and groin may represent a more serious condition than we can currently treat safely. Please tap 'Next Steps' for how to proceed.

screens.content_header_title: We're going to have to end your visit here.

questions.question_title: Where is the rash located on your hands?
Where is the rash located on your feet?
Where in or on your mouth is the rash?

body.text: Eczema that affects the inside of the mouth or throat may represent a more unusual or serious condition than we can treat safely. Please tap 'Next Steps' for how to proceed.

screens.content_header_title: We're going to have to end your visit here.

popup.text: Folds of skin that surround the opening of the vagina

questions.question_title: Has the location of the rash changed since it started?

potential_answers.potential_answer: Yes, it affects more parts of my body now
potential_answers.potential_answer_summary: Yes, it affects more parts of my body now

potential_answers.potential_answer: Yes, it affects fewer parts of my body now
potential_answers.potential_answer_summary: Yes, it affects fewer parts of my body now

questions.question_title: Select the locations where the rash began:
Is the rash mostly between skin creases?
Have you noticed any changes in your fingernails or toenails?
How many fingernails are affected?
How many toenails are affected?
What nail changes have you noticed?

popup.text: Small pinprick holes that appear on the nail surface
Uneven nail surface in the form of ridges

questions.question_title: Do these nail changes occur with the rash?
questions.question_summary: Do nail changes occur with the rash

potential_answers.potential_answer: Yes, they come and go with the rash
potential_answers.potential_answer_summary: Yes, they come and go with the rash

potential_answers.potential_answer: No, they seem unrelated to the rash
potential_answers.potential_answer_summary: No, they seem unrelated to the rash

questions.question_title: How long have you been experiencing nail changes?
Is the rash itchy?
How bad is the itch?
When did the itchiness begin?
Is the itchiness worse at night?
Does the itchiness make it hard for you to sleep?
Are you scratching or picking at the rash?
Describe the rash:
Does discomfort from the rash make your daily activities difficult?
questions.question_summary: Discomfort from rash makes daily activities difficult

questions.question_title: Are you still able to complete basic daily activities, such as walking, eating, and caring for yourself?

body.text: Any illness that prevents you from completing your basic daily activities should be evaluated urgently and in person by a medical professional. Please tap 'Next Steps' for how to proceed.

screens.content_header_title: We're going to have to end your visit here.

If you have health insurance, you should contact your insurance company to find out which providers are covered under your plan. Locate your insurance card and call the listed Member Services number. A representative will help you locate your nearest in-network emergency department. If you are too ill to accomplish this, call 911 and go to the nearest emergency department.

If you do not have health insurance, go to the most convenient emergency department.

screens.content_header_title: You should seek in-person medical evaluation today. A local emergency department is an appropriate option, as is your primary care provider (if you can be seen immediately today).

questions.question_title: Has anybody around you had a rash similar to yours recently?
Have you noticed anything that causes you to have a rash or that makes the rash worse?
questions.question_summary: Anything that causes a rash or makes it worse

questions.question_title: What locations make it worse?

additional_fields.placeholder_text: Describe what locations make your rash worse

questions.question_title: What seasons make it worse?

additional_fields.placeholder_text: Describe the seasons that make your rash worse

questions.question_title: Apart from medications or other treatments, have you noticed anything that prevents you from getting a rash or that makes the rash better?
questions.question_summary: Anything that prevents getting a rash or makes it better

questions.question_title: Have you ever had skin reactions to fake jewelry or nickel products?
questions.question_summary: Prior skin reaction to fake jewelry or nickel products

popup.text: Examples: jewelry, belts, utensils, tools, keys, pots and pans, and even some topical products like eyeshadow

questions.question_title: Tell us about any cosmetic or bath products that may have come into contact with the affected areas:
A variety of factors can influence eczema. Do you regularly do any of the following?

potential_answers.potential_answer: Smoke cigarettes or another form of tobacco
potential_answers.potential_answer_summary: Smoke cigarettes or another form of tobacco

potential_answers.potential_answer: Get a large amount of sun
potential_answers.potential_answer_summary: Get a large amount of sun

potential_answers.potential_answer: Own any pets or spend time with animals
potential_answers.potential_answer_summary: Own any pets or spend time with animals

potential_answers.potential_answer: Do a job or hobby that exposes you to irritants
potential_answers.potential_answer_summary: Do a job or hobby that exposes you to irritants

popup.text: Anything that your skin, hair, or nails might be repeatedly exposed to

potential_answers.potential_answer: Bathe or shower more than once daily
potential_answers.potential_answer_summary: Bathe or shower more than once daily

potential_answers.potential_answer: Bathe or shower in hot or very hot water
potential_answers.potential_answer_summary: Bathe or shower in hot or very hot water

potential_answers.potential_answer: Spend time in very hot or very cold places
potential_answers.potential_answer_summary: Spend time in very hot or very cold places

potential_answers.potential_answer: Spend time in very dry or very humid places
potential_answers.potential_answer_summary: Spend time in very dry or very humid places

questions.question_title: Which animals are you regularly exposed to?
Describe your occupation or hobby and the potential irritants you're exposed to:

screens.header_title: Take photos of the areas where you are currently experiencing a rash.
screens.header_subtitle: Photo quality matters. Your doctor will use these photos to make a diagnosis.

questions.question_title: Face

client_data.tip: Center your face in the dotted lines.
client_data.photo_missing_error_message: A photo of the front of your face is required to continue.

client_data.tip: Turn your face to the side.
client_data.tip_subtext: Just move your face, not your phone.
client_data.photo_missing_error_message: A photo of the side of your face is required to continue.

inline.tip: Take a photo of the left side of your face.

client_data.tip: Now turn to the other side.
client_data.tip_subtext: Just move your face, not your phone.
client_data.photo_missing_error_message: A second photo of the side of your face is required to continue.

inline.tip: Take a photo of the right side of your face.

questions.question_title: Lips

client_data.photo_missing_error_message: A photo of your lips is required to continue.

questions.question_title: Scalp

client_data.tip: Pull back or part hair so your scalp is visible.
client_data.tip_subtext: Use a mirror to help take this photo.
client_data.photo_missing_error_message: A photo of this area is required to continue.

questions.question_title: Neck

client_data.photo_missing_error_message: A photo of this area is required to continue.

questions.question_title: Chest

client_data.tip: Remove any clothing covering your chest.
client_data.photo_missing_error_message: A photo of this area is required to continue.

questions.question_title: Back

client_data.tip: This is a tough photo to take, using a mirror can help.
client_data.photo_missing_error_message: A photo of this area is required to continue.

questions.question_title: Abdomen

client_data.photo_missing_error_message: A photo of this area is required to continue.

questions.question_title: Groin

client_data.photo_missing_error_message: A photo of this area is required to continue.

questions.question_title: Buttocks

client_data.tip: This is a tough photo to take, using a mirror can help.
client_data.photo_missing_error_message: A photo of this area is required to continue.

questions.question_title: Arms

client_data.photo_missing_error_message: A photo of this area is required to continue.

questions.question_title: Legs

client_data.photo_missing_error_message: A photo of this area is required to continue.

questions.question_title: Feet

client_data.tip: Take photos of the tops of your feet resting on a flat surface.
client_data.photo_missing_error_message: Photos of the tops of your feet are required to continue.

client_data.tip: Now take photos of the bottoms of your feet.
client_data.photo_missing_error_message: Photo of the bottoms of your feet are required to continue.

inline.tip: Take photos of the bottoms of your feet.

questions.question_title: Hands

client_data.tip: Take photos of the tops of your hands resting on a flat surface.
client_data.photo_missing_error_message: Photos of the tops of your hands are required to continue.

client_data.tip: Now turn your hands over and take photos of the palms of your hands.
client_data.photo_missing_error_message: Photos of the palms of your hands are required to continue.

inline.tip: Take photos of the palms of your hands.

questions.question_title: Other Location

screens.header_title: Now take photos of your nails.
screens.header_subtitle: Certain nail changes are common with eczema.

questions.question_title: Fingernails

client_data.tip: Make sure your doctor can clearly see your natural nails.
client_data.photo_missing_error_message: Add a photo of your fingernails to continue.

questions.question_title: Toenails

client_data.tip: Make sure your doctor can clearly see your natural nails.
client_data.photo_missing_error_message: Add a photo of your toenails to continue.

questions.question_title: What type of healthcare provider have you previously seen for eczema?
questions.question_summary: Type of healthcare provider previously seen

potential_answers.potential_answer: Internal medicine, family practice, or general practitioner
potential_answers.potential_answer_summary: Internal medicine, family practice, or general practitioner

body.text: Any illness that has already required hospitalization should be reassessed urgently and in person by a medical professional. Please attempt to reach the staff at your previous hospital, or tap 'Next Steps' for how to proceed.

screens.content_header_title: We're going to have to end your visit here.

body.text:
If you have health insurance, you should contact your insurance company to find out which providers are covered under your plan. Locate your insurance card and call the listed Member Services number. A representative will help you locate your nearest in-network urgent care center or other appropriate provider. If you are too ill to accomplish this, call 911 and go to the nearest emergency department.

If you do not have health insurance, go to the most convenient urgent care or emergency department.

screens.content_header_title: You should seek in-person medical evaluation today. A local urgent care is an appropriate option, as is your primary care provider.

questions.question_title: Did your healthcare provider do any testing?

popup.text: A biopsy is a procedure to remove a piece of tissue or a sample of cells from your body so that it can be analyzed in a laboratory.

questions.question_title: Tell us about the <parent_answer_text> your healthcare provider performed:

additional_fields.placeholder_text: Describe the type of test, when it was done, and what the results were

questions.question_title: Share any other relevant information about your previous visit:
Have you tried any topical steroids for eczema?
What topical steroids have you tried for eczema?
What form was it in?
What percentage strength was it?
How many weeks did you use it for?
Did you use it as instructed by its packaging or by a healthcare provider?
Was it helpful?
Do you need a new prescription for it?
Have you tried any other medications for eczema?
What other medications have you tried for eczema?
How long did you use it for?
Did you use it as instructed by its packaging or by a healthcare provider?
Was it helpful?
Do you need a new prescription for it?
Have you tried any other treatments for eczema?
How long did you use it for?
Did you use it as instructed by its packaging or by a healthcare provider?
Was it helpful?
Is there anything else you'd like to tell your doctor about eczema treatments you've tried?

additional_fields.placeholder_text: This is optional but if you have any treatment preferences share them here

questions.question_title: Do you have any of the following medical conditions?
questions.question_subtext: You'll have a chance to tell your doctor about other medical conditions later.

questions.question_title: Have you had a hemoglobin A1c level checked in the past year?
questions.question_summary: HbA1c level checked in past year

questions.question_title: What was your most recent hemoglobin A1c level?
Are your fingerstick blood glucose measurements normally between 100 and 200 mg/dL?
questions.question_summary: Fingerstick blood glucose measurements normally between 100 and 200 mg/dL

questions.question_title: What type of thyroid dysfunction do you have?
Is your thyroid dysfunction currently treated and under control?
questions.question_summary: Thyroid dysfunction is treated and under control

questions.question_title: Do you currently have AIDS?
Do you have a clinic that you follow up with regularly to manage your HIV?
Are you currently pregnant or planning to become pregnant?
Which trimester are you currently in?

popup.text:
1st Trimester: Week 1 to Week 12
2nd Trimester: Week 13 to Week 27
3rd Trimester: Week 28 to Birth

questions.question_title: When will you begin trying to get pregnant?
questions.question_subtext: This influences which medications are safe for you to use.

questions.question_title: Are you currently breastfeeding?
Do you have any other current medical conditions or important past medical history?
questions.question_subtext: Anything for which you see a doctor or take medication is useful to know.

questions.question_title: Do any of your first-degree relatives have one or more of the following conditions?

popup.text: First-degree relatives include parents, siblings, and children. Second-degree relatives include grandparents.

questions.question_title: Are there any medications that you take or use regularly?
Which medications do you take or use regularly?
Are there any supplements that you take regularly?
Which supplements do you take regularly?

additional_fields.placeholder_text: List the supplements or herbs you take and how often

questions.question_title: Are you allergic to any medications?
Which medications are you allergic to?
What type of prescription coverage do you have?
